jrtr
Class GLRenderContext

java.lang.Object
  jrtr.GLRenderContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderContext
public class GLRenderContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements RenderContext

This class implements a RenderContext (a renderer) using OpenGL.

Constructor Detail

GLRenderContext

public GLRenderContext(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
This constructor is called by GLRenderPanel.

Parameters:
drawable - the OpenGL rendering context. All OpenGL calls are directed to this object.
Method Detail

setSceneManager

public void setSceneManager(SceneManagerInterface sceneManager)
Set the scene manager. The scene manager contains the 3D scene that will be rendered. The scene includes geometry as well as the camera and viewing frustum.

Specified by:
setSceneManager in interface RenderContext

display

public void display(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
This method is called by the GLRenderPanel to redraw the 3D scene. The method traverses the scene using the scene manager and passes each object to the rendering method.

beginFrame

private void beginFrame()
This method is called at the beginning of each frame, i.e., before scene drawing starts.

endFrame

private void endFrame()
This method is called at the end of each frame, i.e., after scene drawing is complete.

matrix4fToFloat16

private float[] matrix4fToFloat16(javax.vecmath.Matrix4f m)
Convert a Matrix4f to a float array in column major ordering, as used by OpenGL.

draw

private void draw(RenderItem renderItem)
The main rendering method.

Parameters:
renderItem - the object that needs to be drawn

setMaterial

private void setMaterial(Material m)
Pass the material properties to OpenGL, including textures and shaders. To be implemented in the "Textures and Shading" project.

setLights

void setLights()
Pass the light properties to OpenGL. This assumes the list of lights in the scene manager is accessible via a method Iterator lightIterator(). To be implemented in the "Textures and Shading" project.

cleanMaterial

private void cleanMaterial(Material m)
Disable a material. To be implemented in the "Textures and Shading" project.
